revised_title: The Effect of Freezing on Clay Soils and Flocculation
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Soil Mechanics
tldr: The author investigates the effect of freezing on clay soils and discovers that the process causes dehydration and particle aggregation, leading to flocculation. This phenomenon is similar to the flocculation caused by the addition of acids or salts, and has important implications for understanding soil behavior and the role of water in soil chemistry.
